meanings.definition: Not decomposed; not decayed or rotted.
meanings.sent1: The undecomposed fruit looked fresh and ripe.
meanings.sent2: The undecomposed wood had a natural, earthy scent.
meanings.sent3: The undecomposed leftovers in the fridge were a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her undecomposed enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The undecomposed flowers in the garden added a pop of color.

meanings.definition: Remaining in a state of being not decomposed.
meanings.sent1: The undecomposed leaves on the trees signaled the start of autumn.
meanings.sent2: The undecomposed snow on the ground sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The undecomposed cake on the counter tempted her sweet tooth.
meanings.sent4: His undecomposed energy after a long day was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The undecomposed memories of their childhood brought a smile to her face.

meanings.sent1: The undecomposed body was a mystery to the forensic team.
meanings.sent2: The undecomposed soil retained its rich nutrients for planting.
meanings.sent3: The undecomposed sandwich in his lunchbox was a week old.
meanings.sent4: Her undecomposed patience in the chaotic situation was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The undecomposed ice cream melted quickly in the summer heat.
